intent_atoms.description: Provide a CLI batch mode that allows users to validate multiple files at once and receive aggregated status tables.
Export validation results from the batch command as CSV payloads for CI integration.
The batch command must emit deterministic ordering of summary rows in the console output.
CSV output must be generated with a correct total row and consistent formatting.
Exit codes from the batch command should reflect aggregated results (CI-friendly).
Unmatched glob patterns must not halt the process; diagnostics are printed but continue processing other resolved files.

functional_units.name: isoinspect batch subcommand
functional_units.description: CLI command that accepts a list of files (or glob patterns), streams validation for each file, and outputs aggregated status tables with CI-friendly exit codes.

functional_units.name: BatchValidationSummary utilities
functional_units.description: Functions to render aligned console summaries and CSV payloads for batch validation results, ensuring deterministic ordering and totals.

functional_units.name: CSV summary export feature
functional_units.description: Generates CSV files containing aggregated validation results from batch runs.

functional_units.name: CI-friendly exit code handling
functional_units.description: Exits with appropriate status codes based on aggregate validation outcomes for continuous integration pipelines.

functional_units.name: DocC command reference updates
functional_units.description: Documentation that includes both single-file and batch validation workflows in the command reference.
